title: A startup with its heart in the right place: Tricog wants to save lives, but can it build scale too?
text:
The time taken to rush a heart attack patient to a hospital in India is five to six hours. In most cases, patients don’t get treatment in the first 60 minutes, the crucial period that determines the chances of survival. A startup wants to change that through an algorithm-focused approach. Under Tricog’s model, generating an ECG report and getting it vetted by a team of cardiologists takes less than six minutes.

(From left) Tricog founders Zainul Charbiwala, Abhinav Gujjar, Udayan Dasgupta, and Charit Bhograj

is on technological innovation, at the heart of Tricog is an intervention cardiologist whose mission is to tap human expertise, using AI to enable faster diagnoses. However, that mission statement will also have to impress a long list of investors and get Tricog an equal footing with rivals in the West. ( Graphics by Sadhana Saxena and Mohammad Arshad) "I remember the scene very clearly. He was brought into the emergency room and had no pulse. The ECG was showing a massive heart attack," says Charit Bhograj, recalling the incident that changed him completely. It was 2009, and Bhograj was a consulting cardiologist at Bengaluru’s Fortis Hospital. The 40-year-old patient in front of him had mistaken the earlyis on technological innovation, at the heart of Tricog is an intervention cardiologist whose mission is to tap human expertise, using AI to enable faster diagnoses. However, that mission statement will also have to impress a long list of investors and get Tricog an equal footing with rivals in the West. ( Graphics by Sadhana Saxena and Mohammad Arshad)
